greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes p such that prime(n)*p - 2 is prime and p <= prime(n).
comment: Conjecture: All items of this sequence are greater than or equal to 1. Tested to prime(1000000).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Table[p=Prime[n]; ct=0; Do[pk=Prime[k]; If[PrimeQ[p*pk-2], ct=ct+1], {k, n}]; ct, {n, 100}]
program: let p = a000040 n, q <- takeWhile (<= p) a000040_list]
results.author: _Lei Zhou_, Feb 22 2005
